clinical_study.brief_title: Do we Prepare Patients for Their Digital Legacy? A Survey of Palliative Care Professionals in the West Midlands
clinical_study.official_title: Do we Prepare Patients for Their Digital Legacy? A Survey of Palliative Care Professionals in the West Midlands

lead_sponsor.agency: The Royal Wolverhampton Hospitals NHS Trust

clinical_study.source: The Royal Wolverhampton Hospitals NHS Trust

brief_summary.textblock: Conduct a questionnaire survey of palliative care professionals including doctors, nurses and social workers currently working within the West Midlands to establish how much the palliative care community in the West Midlands engage in preparing patients for their digital legacy and find out if there is a further education need in this community about digital legacy.

primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire establishing a baseline measure from which to monitor changes over time in professionals' behaviour.

intervention.description: Questionnaire to be completed by staff

study_pop.textblock: Palliative care professionals (medical, nursing and social worker) affiliated to a hospice in the West Midlands.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Palliative care professionals (medical, nursing and social worker) affiliated to a hospice in the West Midlands.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical, nursing or social worker not working in a hospice in the West Midlands.
